title: 820-00281 no SUS voltages
message:
I'm working on 820-00281 board which is not turning on. Customer states, that it just died with no reason. There is no liquid or physical damage, no corrosion, no other repair attempts. Board switches to 20V but gets stuck at 0,04A. The PP1V8_SUS and PP3V3_SUS are missing, no shorts. Also PM_SLP_SUS_L is low with 0,003V. 

PPBUS_G3H - 12,57V
PP3V3_G3H - 3,41V
PP3V3_S5 - 3,30V

U7800 and the area around looks really good, but I have replaced it just on case with no result. 

PPBUS_PMIC - 12,57V
PP3V3_PMICLDO - 3,29V
PP5V_PMICLDO - 5,00V

On thermal camera I can see, that PCH get slightly warmer in two areas amd my guess is PCH is dead. Maybe you have other suggestions?

title: 820-00281 no SUS voltages
message:
PCH should be cold in this stage.
Check diode mode to ground on all coils, especially PCH and CPU; compare with good board.

title: 820-00281 no SUS voltages
message: After I have posted this thread I have discovered, that PP1V0_SUS / PP1V_PCH_REG_R are shorted - 0,000V in diode mode and 0,001 Ohm. If I inject 1V, board takes ~0,3 - 0,5A but nothing really gets warm, even PCH. I have lifted up L8000 and short appers to be at PCH side.

title: 820-00281 no SUS voltages
message:
Two power rails shorted denote a problem with the common point, PCH.
You can't heat anything with 0.5W; maybe IR camera sees very small difference between PCH and rest of the MLB.

title: 820-00281 no SUS voltages
message: Yes, I'm going to replace PCH and clean ME region in BIOS.

title: 820-00281 no SUS voltages
message: So I have replaced PCH, both PP1V0_SUS / PP1V_PCH_REG_R lines are now present, nothing shorted. Board starts, CPU VCORE is present, all S0 voltages too but there is no video, no chime, just clicking trackpad. Board takes ~1A from charger. I have already tried new bios found on this forum, but it hasn't changed anything. Could you please share known 100% working bios with clean ME?

title: 820-00281 no SUS voltages
message: Ok, with this BIOS everything works, problem solved. Thank you [USER=682]@2informaticos[/USER] for your help.
